title: Is there any chance of fixing Qiyana's ult hitbox on north-facing terrain?
body:
tl;dr the hitbox of the explosion is slightly south of the edge of the terrain.

This means that if the explosion is facing south, it can and will hit champions who aren't even touching the explosion effect.
If it's facing north, the explosion won't hit champions even if they're touching the edge of the explosion.

The explosion is essentially larger when it's moving along south facing terrain, which causes a lot of awkwardness and inconsistency when playing Qiyana.

replies.body:

>
> {{sticker:sg-lux-2}}

Go to top lane.
Ult downwards, against a wall near the river or below top side turret.
Even if a champion's model is clipping the edge of the explosion, they will not get hit by it. They have to be somewhat far inside the explosion in order to get it.

Go to bottom side jungle, by the dragon pit.
Ult upwards, against the dragon pit wall.
This explosion will hit champions who aren't even touching the edge of the explosion. You can be about 25% of the explosion radius away from the wall and still get hit by it.

In the first scenario, the explosion basically has less radius.
